= Project Status =

== What's New in MatrixPilot 2.0 ==

  * Combine the functionality of MatrixNav and AileronAssist into a single firmware.
  * Supports navigation using both ailerons and rudder.
  * Increase the number of Radio Input channels (from 4 to 5), and Servo Output channels (from 3 to 6).
  * Support controlling Delta wing and VTail airframes, in addition to Standard airframes with or without ailerons.
  * More responsive to switching between Manual, Stabilized, and Waypoint modes.
  * Support using the new uBlox GPS for faster navigation responses.
  * Super-basic camera stabilization code.
  * Add serial telemetry output in a variety of formats.
    * Support for telemetry output in our own UAV Dev Board format.
    * Support for telemetry output using an Ardupilot Ground Station compatible format.
    * Support for NMEA output to a Remzibi OSD.

== Future Roadmap ==

As with all long term plans, these could change at any time, but here's where we're thinking we'll go in the near future.

=== MatrixPilot 2.1 ===

This version will include features that are either needed or helpful for users participating in the [http://www.sparkfun.com/commerce/product_info.php?products_id=9016 SparkFun Autonomous Vehicle Challenge] on April 17th, 2010.  Plus whichever other goodies make their way in.

  * Add support for absolute waypoints.
  * Improve robustness of launching while in Waypoint mode.
  * Possibly add support for automatic detection of, and adjustment for average wind speed and direction.
  * ...
